content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: The song’s rise to the top of the chart had been meteoric.
Taylor’s precocity in music had emerged by his third birthday.
The science club was thrilled by the lab’s proffer of meeting space and experimental materials.
To distinguish himself from his voluble twin, Brett tried to be more succinct.
Jesse faced the principal with trepidation.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: Jack grew weary of Bobby’s always deprecating any new idea.
Try not to discomfit newcomers with too many personal questions.
Maria was careful not to trip on the rift in the sidewalk.
Isabella’s overbearing manner annoyed her coworkers.
Getting a flat tire on the way to a job interview is particularly untoward.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: A child is most likely to remonstrate with a parent about which of the following?
A virtuoso performance is most likely to be
Blandishments are not intended to
A sylvan setting is full of
Which of the following is a solicitous friend least likely to do?

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: When I arrived at the dance studio, Denali was staring at herself in the mirror, her arms crossed, frowning at her reflection. She was dressed in a bright skirt and a black leotard, ready for her performance at the African Festival.
“I keep messing up. I guess I just wasn’t born with rhythm,” she said sourly. Nothing could have been further from the truth, but she tended to deprecate herself when she was nervous.

“Are you kidding me? You were born with rhythm, energy, grace… uh…” I paused, trying to think of more ways to bolster her confidence. She turned and put up her hand to silence me before I could proffer any more blandishments.
“You’re just biased because you’re my friend!”
“Listen,” I said firmly. “I know you feel some trepidation. That’s natural. But you’re going to be great tonight. You practiced all week.”
Denali turned back to the mirror. She tilted her head at her reflection, sighed, and placed both hands on her hips, rocking back and forth on her heels.
I patted her shoulder in my usual solicitous way. “You are going to be great,” I repeated. “Trust me.”

content.question: In line 7, deprecate most nearly means
The meaning of proffer (line 12) is
In line 12, blandishments means
The word trepidation (line 14) most nearly means
In line 20, solicitous means
